com.pb.sawdust.util.exceptions

Class RuntimeIOException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.pb.sawdust.util.exceptions.RuntimeWrappingException
            • com.pb.sawdust.util.exceptions.RuntimeIOException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class RuntimeIOException
extends RuntimeWrappingException
    The RuntimeIOException is a wrapper for the checked exception IOException and its descendents. It is intended to be used to wrap the checked exception to allow it to be thrown without being declared. This lower the programming burden (and perhaps annoyance) though it does raise the possiblity that some recoverable exceptions may be allowed to percolate to runtime. Therefore, the use of this class should be clearly documented.
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuntimeIOException

        public RuntimeIOException(java.io.IOException ioException)
        Construction specifying the IOException this class is wrapping.
        Parameters:
        ioException - The exception for this class to wrap.

      • RuntimeIOException

        public RuntimeIOException()
        Constructs a new runtime io exception with null as its detail message. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to RuntimeWrappingException.initCause(java.lang.Throwable).

      • RuntimeIOException

        public RuntimeIOException(java.lang.String message)
        Constructs a new runtime io exception with the specified detail message. The cause is not initialized, and may subsequently be initialized by a call to RuntimeWrappingException.initCause(java.lang.Throwable).
        Parameters:
        message - The detail message.

      • RuntimeIOException

        public RuntimeIOException(java.lang.String message,
                  java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Constructs a new runtime io exception with the specified detail message and cause.
        Parameters:
        message - The detail message.
        cause - The cause of the exception. (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)

      • RuntimeIOException

        public RuntimeIOException(java.lang.Throwable cause,
                  boolean dummyForCause)
        Constructs a new runtime wrapping exception with the specified cause.
        Parameters:
        cause - The cause of the exception. (A null value is permitted, and indicates that the cause is nonexistent or unknown.)
        dummyForCause - A dummy variable which is not used, but which differentiates this method from RuntimeIOException(Exception).
